sub_title: Principal Design Eng. | GaN Technology at Gallium Semiconductor
summary:
Highly motivated Radio Frequency / Microwave design and modelling Engineer specializing in R&D of high power discrete and integrated RF transistors, RFPA and large signal measurement in Si-LDMOS + GaN SiC semiconductor technologies. Deep interest with successful conceptual studies + prototyping of high power, integrated broadband RF transistors and RFPA architectures for Doherty application, including research of alternate design techniques and technologies using a holistic approach. Capable of converting system requirements to device prototype and line up for introduction to industrialized volume. Benefits from industrial + academic research environments including past and current industry experience in Europe. Also possessing a broad background in passive microwave design.

Design, modelling and measurement experience includes:

• Concept study + detailed design of high power, broadband integrated RF transistors for Doherty and non-Doherty applications
• Load modulated [Doherty] power amplifiers - Integrated | Symmetrical | Asymmetrical architectures.
• Waveform engineering for harmonically tuned classes.
• Detailed line-up analysis of complete chain and driver / final stage dimensioning within the transmitter chain.
• Small signal + large signal measurement of RF transistor + RFPA including load pull bench measurements.
• High degree of expertise in developing and validating amplifier modelling techniques, successfully developed a co-simulation approach for high quality RF transistor and RFPA models.

• Integration, interpretation and fitting of measured data into RF transistor and RFPA models.
• Highly proficient in using MWO [linear + non-linear engines + Axiem and Analyst electromagnetic analysis]. 
• Proficient in HFSS, TCAD, ACAD, Klayout

Additional non-active experience includes:

• Waveguide combiners | dividers | transitions | couplers | filters | mono-pulse comparators up to 30GHz
• Lumped element lo | hi | bandpass | diplex filters up to 1GHz

Academic experience of the following:

• Authorship of published papers [IET, IEEE, ARMMS].
• Authorship of invited journal technical articles [Microwave Journal].
• Technical presentations and webinars for multi-disciplinary audiences in the UK and abroad.
• Knowledge Transfer Partnerships [KTPs] | High efficiency L-Band power amplifier project.
• Horizon2020 | Industry partner focused on 5G load modulation [GaN based Doherty].
• Mentored Early Stage Researchers [ESRs] and associates in KTP and H2020 projects.
• Peer review academic papers.
• EuMW reviewer.
• IEEE MTT-S technical committee affiliate.

treasury_media.title: Power Amplifier Design Forum
treasury_media.description: Date Nov 17 Time 10:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. EST Cadence is the exclusive sponsor of the Power Amplifier Design Forum virtual event!

treasury_media.title: Design Example: SARAS' Broadband High Power Amplifier (HPA)
treasury_media.description: This presentation demonstrates a design methodology for a broadband high-power amplifier used in CW operation. The design uses an integrated co-simulation approach incorporating load pull for optimal impedance extraction, network synthesis, and electromagnetic analysis. The design flow demonstrated uses a nonlinear GaN HEMT model, ATC capacitor models, and MWO software for EM analysis and layout. Also demonstrated is a method for source and load impedance network measurement and optimal tuning.

profile_positions.title: Principal Design Eng. | RF Transistor / Device for RFPA / DPA | GaN Technology

profile_positions.description:
Design, modelling and characterization of GaN devices. Developed prototype integrated load modulated PA architectures and knowledge base in early phase environment. 

• Design, modelling, development and characterization of    <6GHz GaN based load modulated power amplifiers.
• Development of EDA modelling techniques.
• Design, development and characterization of semiconductor technologies.
• Identification of potential IP opportunities and where appropriate, extraction of. 
• Contribute to competitor analysis and development of technology roadmaps from technology to architecture levels. 
• Co-assist in the initial establishment of a Leeds based GaN team (small contribution).
profile_positions.title: Device and RFPA for 5G, MCM, MMIC | GaN Technology

profile_positions.description:
Design and modelling of discrete high power RF transistor devices for mobile broadband applications.

• Design of high power Si-LDMOS transistors for macro base-station applications in sub bands 1.8 to  2.7GHz.
• RF transistor design specifically for Doherty architectures.
• S-parameter and load pull bench characterization of RF power transistors.
• RF Transistor modelling and measurement fitting.
• Detailed line-up analysis and dimensioning for transmitter chain.
• Designed concept and prototype for high power in a compact ceramic package study in 1.8 / 1.9 / 2.2 / 2.7GHz bands. Output of project suitable for high volume production and currently [2022] being released.
profile_positions.title: Principal RF and Microwave Power Transistor Designer

profile_positions.description: Provided detailed design knowledge and techniques with respect to modelling, Doherty architectures and load modulation design concepts for H2020 in house Early Stage Researcher (ESR). Contributed as co-author to academic publications. Duties undertaken in parallel with current employment.
profile_positions.title: Horizon 2020 Industrial Partner | Power Amplifier Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Detailed design and development of solid state RF / Microwave power amplifiers (SSPAs) for surveillance, broadcast, military and commercial applications.

• Single ended, balanced, distributed + load    modulated solid state power amplifier design
• Output powers - 0.5W to >1kW
• Frequency ranges - 100MHz to 5GHz
• Bandwidths - single freq to decade bandwidth
• Use of LDMOS, GaN + GaAs transistor technologies
• Validation of transistor compact models
• Design of Tx line up architecture + DC requirements
• Linear SSPA designs for high PAPR application
• Non-linear SSPA designs for CW + pulsed applications
• Design for bias line memory effect
• Layout of prototype circuits + test plates
• Evaluation + development of PA prototypes on test bench
• Authorship and presentation of technical feasibility studies and technology reviews

Achievements:

• Developed a co-simulation based SSPA design flow incorporating load pull, network synthesis, EM analysis and layout that resulted in high degree of modeled vs measured accuracy and significantly reduced development time. Using this design methodology a 0.7 - 2.5GHz (89% fractional BW), 100W RFPA design required no tuning of the 1st prototype and delivered required power over the operating bandwidth.

• Developed a calibrated measurement technique using a jig that enabled measurement and tuning of fabricated transistor source and load networks. This enabled a practical and accurate method of optimizing networks and working with model vs measured datasets.

Software:

• NI Microwave Office | Linear, Non-Linear, Electromagnetic
• CST | FD, TD, Thermal
• HFSS | FD
• Genesys Eagleware | Linear
• Autodesk Autocad | 2D

Test Equipment: 

• Signal generators, spectrum analysers, VNAs, VSA's, power meters and oscilloscopes.
profile_positions.title: Senior Microwave Design Engineer | Power Amplifier Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Design and development of waveguide components (experience up to 20GHz) for commercial, space, military and scientific applications from initial customer specification, hardware design \ EM modelling,  lab development \ testing, through to product delivery.   

• Design of waveguide components; tees, bends, comparators, pyramidal horn antennas, bandpass filters, high power loads, couplers. 
• 3D electromagnetic modelling and simulation using CST and HFSS packages.
• Test \ measurement of waveguide components and systems.
• Writing of test plans and procedures to support lab testing of components.
• Off-site antenna testing and qualification.
• Basic mechanical test fixture design including design of test adaptors.
• Working within a multi-disciplinary team alongside Mechanical Engineers.
• Authorship of progress \ technical reports and design reviews with customers at home and abroad.
profile_positions.title: Microwave Design Engineer | Waveguide

profile_positions.description:
Recruited by M/A-COM to work within the passive group. Development of passive components for CATV applications.

• Design and prototype of lumped element diplexers, high\low pass filters (up to 1GHz) from initial customer specification, synthesis, EM simulation and layout through to testing,  qualification, data sheets and product release documentation.
• Basic test fixture design for lab development and testing purposes.
• Test, measurement, characterisation and qualification of filters.
• Product release of designs into volume production (400K+)
profile_positions.title: RF Design Engineer | CATV Filters

profile_positions.description:
Development of 2.5GHz WiMAX radio for 20W and 40W variants from initial build to pre-production low volume production runs. 

• Radio lab tests. 
• De-bug of prototypes including RF, DC and baseband stages
• Characterisation of radio performance
• Evaluation of transmitter and receiver chains
• Generation of failure mode analysis spreadsheets for prototype rounds against module specification
profile_positions.title: RF Development Technician | WiMAX Basestation Development

profile_positions.description:
Recruited by Filtronic to work within the RF ‘Actives’ group. Development of complex RF \ Microwave products for cellular base-station applications.

• Evaluation and development of high performance, low-cost active RF Electronics for basestation applications.
• Evaluation of supporting analogue and digital electronics.
• High level of competance with RF \ DC test and measurement.
• Competent assembly, soldering (to 0402 level), inspection and fault finding of RF\DC prototypes from schematics.
• Use of software tools for RF \ DC circuit simulation.
• Manufacture of prototype PCB boards.
• Developed RF test set-ups for internal testing and qualification.
• Test equipment specification and component sourcing.
• Working as part of a multidisciplinary team during New Product Introduction (including PCB draughtsman, mechanical, test, software, and manufacturing engineers).
• Selection and supervision of appropriate work for Test Technicians.
• Technical authorship of debug guides.
profile_positions.title: RF Development Technician | GSM / W-CDMA Basestation Development

volunteer_experiences.description: Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics Network (West Yorkshire branch). Promotion and raising awareness of the STEM subjects and careers to students in schools.
